Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.24172540] Gram-positive bacteria:S. aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC = 3.1 μM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC = 1.6 μM), S.epidermidis RP62A (MIC = 1.6 μM), S.epidermidis RP62A/1 (MIC = 0.8 μM), C.albicans ATCC 90028 (MIC = 50 μM);Gram-negative bacteria:E.coli (MIC = 3.1 μM), A. baumannii (MIC = 3.1 μM), S. maltophilia (MIC = 1.6 μM), K. pneumoniae (MIC = 3.1 μM), P. aeruginosa (MIC = 6.25 μM), P.mirabilis (MIC > 100 μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.24172540] LC₅₀ = 85 ± 5 μM against freshly prepared human erythrocytes.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: No structure indentification experiment and detailed structure description found
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
Sequence Information.Comments: The peptide, at a concentration of 2.5 μM, significantly (P<0.05) stimulates the production of the anti-inflammatory IL-4 and IL-10 but is without significant effect on production of the pro-inflammatory cytokines TNF-α and IL-17

Literature.Title: An analog of the host-defense peptide hymenochirin-1B with potent broad-spectrum activity against multidrug-resistant bacteria and immunomodulatory properties
Literature.Author: Milena Mechkarska, Manju Prajeep, Gordana D Radosavljevic, Ivan P Jovanovic, Amna Al Baloushi, Agnes Sonnevend, Miodrag L Lukic, J Michael Conlon
